page.title: 20Westholme Hall.
page.content: The smith repairs agricultural machinery and makes decorative metalwork to order accounting for half of the business. Westholme Hall, a 17th century house was part of the Raby estate till 1892 at ehich time it was Domestic servants found well paid employment at the Glaxo Laboratories after 1946. Westholme now has 275 acres which produce wheat, barley,oats,and oil seed rape. Peas will be sown in l986. There are 75 acres of permanent pasture for 60 mule ewes which they cross with a Suffolk ram. Westholme Hall has recently been subdivided into self-contained flats for commuting families. No men are employed at Westholme as all work is put out to contractors. Some land is let to a farmer with Holstein heifers.
